marketNews.title: PGAS Adds More Than 71.8 BBtud Gas Supply
marketNews.content:
PGAS announced new gas supply additions with a volume exceeding 71.83 BBtud, signed during the IPA Convention & Exhibition on Wednesday (21/5). This gas supply originates from several blocks, detailed as follows:

Specifically for the domestic gas swap agreement, the agreement stipulates that a certain volume of pipeline gas from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks previously sold to Singapore will be replaced by gas from the Natuna Block (South Natuna Sea Block B, Natuna Sea Block A, and Kakap PSC). The volume from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks previously sold to Singapore will be allocated to meet domestic gas demand, with PGAS acting as the domestic buyer.

The additional gas supply coming from various E&P blocks - both in the form of pipeline gas and LNG - provides supply certainty for the Sumatra and West Java regions. Previously, the President Director of PGAS, Arief S. Handoko, warned that a gas deficit in the West Java up to North Sumatra region would occur between 2025-2035. This decline is caused by natural declining from suppliers, which has not yet been offset by new reserve discoveries and production from new gas fields.

Until now, it is still unknown whether this additional gas supply will be allocated for the Gas for Certain Electricity Generation (HGBT) incentive price or non-HGBT. Previously, the government set the gas price under the HGBT incentive at 6.5-7 US dollars per MMBtu from January 2025 for the next 5 years. Purchases exceeding the volume quota will be subject to a regasification tariff of 16.77 US dollars per MMBtu.

Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramics Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the fulfillment of the HGBT volume quota is decreasing due to gas supply disruptions. In April 2025, the fulfillment of the HGBT volume quota in West Java fell to 65.3% (vs. March 2025: 77%) and East Java plummeted to 48.8% (vs. March 2025: 61%).

Key Takeaway

The increase in gas supply from various blocks provides a positive sentiment for PGAS amid declining supply due to natural declining from suppliers. Furthermore, the increase in gas supply from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks potentially increases PGAS's gas sales volume because the price of pipeline gas is cheaper compared to the regasified gas price.

Although it is still unknown whether this additional supply will increase the gas volume for HGBT, this additional supply is expected to suppress the blended cost of gas energy used by related industrial sectors. This can benefit companies that rely on gas as their main energy source, such as Arwana Citramulia ($ARNA).

marketNews.title: ANTM Reported to Seek US$500 Million Syndicated Loan
marketNews.content:
1. Bloomberg reported that Aneka Tambang is seeking a loan facility of 500 million US dollars or 8.2 trillion Rupiah, potentially the first US Dollar denominated syndicated credit from a State-Owned Enterprise (SOE) in 2025. Bloomberg sources stated that the loan has a 5-year tenor and is intended for the company's general purposes such as capital expenditure and working capital. The credit facility will be coordinated by United Overseas Bank and will consist of a term loan facility and revolving credit.
2. Shareholders of Adaro Andalan Indonesia approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 2.2 billion US dollars, equivalent to a 183% dividend payout ratio. This entire amount was distributed in June 2024, before the company's IPO. Therefore, AADI will not distribute additional dividends. This decision is in line with what we wrote in the Stockbit Commentary in March 2025.
3. Shareholders of Elnusa approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 285.5 billion Rupiah or 39.11 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 40% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 8.2% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known.
4. Energi Mega Persada signed an agreement to purchase a 25% participating interest in the Kangean Block from Japan Petroleum Exploration Co. Ltd. (Japex) with an undisclosed transaction value. After this transaction is completed, ENRG will become the sole controller of the Kangean Block through its subsidiaries. In a separate transaction, ENRG signed an agreement to sell a 50% participating interest in the Gebang Block to Japex with an undisclosed transaction value. After this transaction is completed, ENRG's participating interest ownership in the Gebang Block will decrease to 50%. ENRG explained that the partnership with Japex in the block will accelerate field development through better funding access, sophisticated subsurface modeling, and more efficient project execution.
5. Malindo Feedmill shareholders on Thursday (22/5) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 145.5 billion Rupiah or 65 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of approximately 30% and indicates a dividend yield of 8.5% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date have not been announced.
6. Shareholders of Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa on Wednesday (21/5) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 867.6 billion Rupiah or 259 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to approximately 43% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~16%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.6% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiated market is June 2, 2025, while the payment date is June 20, 2025.
7. Kalbe Farma shareholders approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to 1.7 trillion Rupiah or 36 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 52% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 2.5% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known. KLBF shareholders also approved the appointment of Ronny Hadiana as President Commissioner and Herijanto Irawan as an Independent Commissioner of the company.
8. The Corporate Secretary of Kawasan Industri Jababeka, Muljadi Suganda, told Kontan that the company recorded industrial land sales of approximately 1.1 trillion Rupiah in 1Q25, surging +117% YoY from the realization of approximately 504.5 billion Rupiah in 1Q24. During 1Q25 itself, KIJA recorded marketing sales of 1.2 trillion Rupiah (+88% YoY), equivalent to 34% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion Rupiah.
9. Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama announced plans to divest its plastic packaging business - comprising all assets and liabilities related to that business - for 70 billion Rupiah to a non-affiliated party. This value is equivalent to 121% of the company's total equity as of the end of 2024. This plan will be discussed in the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on June 30, 2025.

marketNews.title: Other Hot Topics You Need to Know
marketNews.content:
1. The Chairman of the Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU), Muhammad Fanshurullah Asa, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that they have started a review to identify risks from the potential merger between Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO). Grab and GOTO have not officially confirmed the merger plan, but Reuters reported that the two companies are striving to reach an agreement in 2Q25.
2. The Chairman of the Supervisory Board of BPJS Ketenagakerjaan, Muhammad Zuhri, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that they estimate the number of employees affected by layoffs (PHK) could surge up to 280,000 people throughout 2025, an increase of +259% YoY compared to the 2024 realization of 77,965 people. The number of Job Loss Guarantee (JKP) claims in 4M25 alone has reached 52,850 claims, nearly equaling the total JKP claims during 2024 which stood at 57,960 claims.
3. The Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, stated that the government is finalizing revisions to tax regulations for oil and gas (migas) contractors using the gross split production sharing contract scheme. Djoko mentioned that the regulation could be issued soon and is aimed at boosting upstream migas sector investment incentives. Djoko explained that this regulation revision will simplify the gross split contract, where the amendments cover indirect tax, DMO fuel price, monitoring, and evaluation based on a single parameter.
4. The Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that the government has appointed an SOE company to become the BPI Danantara investment holding. Erick did not specify the identity of the SOE, but he explained that the company has long been engaged in investment and will operate under BPI Danantara. Previously, the government had designated PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia as the operational holding for BPI Danantara.
5. The President Director of PT Freeport Indonesia, Tony Wenas, stated that the company's smelter in JIIPE, Gresik, has resumed operations earlier than expected. Tony stated that the smelter is expected to produce copper cathodes in the 4th week of June 2025 and reach full production capacity in December 2025.
6. Bitcoin hit an all-time high, rising nearly +3% to around 110,000 US dollars per unit in morning trading on Thursday (22/5), following progress in the stablecoin bill draft which is now ready to be discussed by the US Senate. Bloomberg reported that a bipartisan group hopes the US Senate can pass the regulatory draft as early as this week, although senators indicated that the final vote might be postponed until after the Memorial Day recess on May 26, 2025.
7. The controller of Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia ($ISSP), PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, purchased approximately 11.1 million ISSP shares at a price of 295 Rupiah per share on May 21, 2025. The total transaction reached approximately 3.3 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra's ownership in ISSP increased from 56.12% to 56.28%.
8. The Attorney General's Office on Wednesday (21/5) named 3 individuals as suspects in alleged corruption related to bank loans to Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL), consisting of former SRIL President Director Iwan Setiawan Lukminto, former Bank DKI President Director Zainuddin Mappa, and former official of Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten ($BJBR) Dicky Syahbandinata. The corruption investigation is related to unsecured loans to SRIL totaling about 693 billion Rupiah. A Director at the Attorney General's Office, Abdul Qohar, stated that the bank officials did not conduct adequate analysis or adhere to procedural requirements in granting the loans.

marketNews.title: Emerging Market Opportunities Amidst US Tariffs
marketNews.content: "Fell a lot because of tariffs, but when the tariffs were postponed (not canceled), it rose higher than before the tariffs." - Yanuard

tickerNews.title: PGAS Secures Additional Gas Supply of Over 71.8 BBtud via Swap and Direct Supply
tickerNews.content: Perusahaan Gas Negara ($PGAS) announced new gas supply additions with a volume exceeding 71.83 BBtud, signed during the IPA Convention & Exhibition on Wednesday (21/5). This gas supply originates from several blocks. Specifically for the domestic gas swap agreement, the agreement stipulates that a certain volume of pipeline gas from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks previously sold to Singapore will be replaced by gas from the Natuna Block (South Natuna Sea Block B, Natuna Sea Block A, and Kakap PSC). The volume from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks previously sold to Singapore will be allocated to meet domestic gas demand, with PGAS as the domestic buyer. The additional gas supply coming from various E&P blocks - both in the form of pipeline gas and LNG - provides supply certainty for the Sumatra and West Java regions. The Chairman of the Indonesian Ceramics Association, Edy Suyanto, stated that the fulfillment of the HGBT volume quota is decreasing due to gas supply disruptions. On the Key Takeaway, the increase in gas supply from various blocks provides a positive sentiment for PGAS. Furthermore, the increase in gas supply from the Corridor and Jabung Blocks potentially increases PGAS's gas sales volume because the price of pipeline gas is cheaper compared to the regasified gas price.

tickerNews.title: Added Gas Supply May Benefit ARNA by Lowering Blended Energy Cost
tickerNews.content: The additional gas supply is expected to suppress the blended cost of gas energy used by related industrial sectors. This can provide benefits for companies that rely on gas as their main energy source, such as Arwana Citramulia ($ARNA).

tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Elnusa ($ELSA) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 285.5 billion Rupiah or 39.11 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 40% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 8.2% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known.

tickerNews.title: ENRG Acquires 25% Interest in Kangean Block, Sells 50% in Gebang Block to Japex
tickerNews.content: Energi Mega Persada ($ENRG) signed an agreement to purchase a 25% participating interest in the Kangean Block from Japan Petroleum Exploration Co. Ltd. (Japex) with an undisclosed transaction value. After this transaction is completed, ENRG will become the sole controller of the Kangean Block through its subsidiaries. In a separate transaction, ENRG signed an agreement to sell a 50% participating interest in the Gebang Block to Japex with an undisclosed transaction value. After this transaction is completed, ENRG's participating interest ownership in the Gebang Block will decrease to 50%. ENRG explained that the partnership with Japex in the block will accelerate field development through better funding access, sophisticated subsurface modeling, and more efficient project execution.

tickerNews.title: MAIN Shareholders Approved 2024 Dividend Distribution Indicating 8.5% Yield
tickerNews.content: Malindo Feedmill ($MAIN) shareholders on Thursday (22/5) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 145.5 billion Rupiah or 65 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a dividend payout ratio of approximately 30% and indicates a dividend yield of 8.5% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date have not been announced.

tickerNews.title: INTP Shareholders Approved 2024 Dividend Distribution at 43% Payout Ratio (Yield 4.6%)
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa ($INTP) on Wednesday (21/5) approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to approximately 867.6 billion Rupiah or 259 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to approximately 43% dividend payout ratio (vs. 2023: ~16%) and indicates a dividend yield of 4.6% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date in the regular and negotiated market is June 2, 2025, while the payment date is June 20, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KLBF Shareholders Approved 2024 Dividend Distribution at 52% Payout Ratio and Approved Commissioner Changes
tickerNews.content: Kalbe Farma ($KLBF) shareholders approved the 2024 fiscal year dividend distribution plan amounting to 1.7 trillion Rupiah or 36 Rupiah per share. This amount is equivalent to a 52% dividend payout ratio and indicates a dividend yield of 2.5% as of Thursday (22/5). The cum date and payment date are not yet known. KLBF shareholders also approved the appointment of Ronny Hadiana as President Commissioner and Herijanto Irawan as an Independent Commissioner of the company.

tickerNews.title: KIJA Land Sales Hit ~Rp1.1 Trillion in 1Q25 (+117% YoY)
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of Kawasan Industri Jababeka ($KIJA), Muljadi Suganda, told Kontan that the company recorded industrial land sales of approximately 1.1 trillion Rupiah in 1Q25, surging +117% YoY from the realization of approximately 504.5 billion Rupiah in 1Q24. During 1Q25 itself, KIJA recorded marketing sales of 1.2 trillion Rupiah (+88% YoY), equivalent to 34% of the 2025 target of 3.5 trillion Rupiah.

tickerNews.title: PACK Announces Plan to Divest Plastic Packaging Business for Rp70 Billion
tickerNews.content: Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama ($PACK) announced plans to divest its plastic packaging business - comprising all assets and liabilities related to that business - for 70 billion Rupiah to a non-affiliated party. This value is equivalent to 121% of the company's total equity as of the end of 2024. This plan will be discussed in the GMS Extraordinary Meeting on June 30, 2025.

tickerNews.title: KPPU Starts Review on Risks of Potential Grab-GOTO Merger
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the Business Competition Supervisory Commission (KPPU), Muhammad Fanshurullah Asa, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that they have started a review to identify risks from the potential merger between Grab Holdings Ltd. (Nasdaq: GRAB) and GoTo Gojek Tokopedia ($GOTO). Grab and GOTO have not officially confirmed the merger plan, but Reuters reported that the two companies are striving to reach an agreement in 2Q25.

tickerNews.title: BPJS Ketenagakerjaan Estimates Layoffs to Hit 280,000 in 2025 (+259% YoY)
tickerNews.content: The Chairman of the Supervisory Board of BPJS Ketenagakerjaan, Muhammad Zuhri, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that they estimate the number of employees affected by layoffs (PHK) could surge up to 280,000 people throughout 2025, an increase of +259% YoY compared to the 2024 realization of 77,965 people. The number of Job Loss Guarantee (JKP) claims in 4M25 alone has reached 52,850 claims, nearly equaling the total JKP claims during 2024 which stood at 57,960 claims.

tickerNews.title: Government Finalizing Tax Rule Revisions for Gross Split Migas Contracts to Boost Upstream Investment
tickerNews.content: The Head of SKK Migas, Djoko Siswanto, stated that the government is finalizing revisions to tax regulations for oil and gas (migas) contractors using the gross split production sharing contract scheme. Djoko mentioned that the regulation could be issued soon and is aimed at boosting upstream migas sector investment incentives. Djoko explained that this regulation revision will simplify the gross split contract, where the amendments cover indirect tax, DMO fuel price, monitoring, and evaluation based on a single parameter.

tickerNews.title: SOE Minister Taps Investment Holding Company for BPI Danantara
tickerNews.content: The Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Erick Thohir, stated on Wednesday (21/5) that the government has appointed an SOE company to become the BPI Danantara investment holding. Erick did not specify the identity of the SOE, but he explained that the company has long been engaged in investment and will operate under BPI Danantara. Previously, the government had designated PT Biro Klasifikasi Indonesia as the operational holding for BPI Danantara.

tickerNews.title: Freeport Indonesia Smelter Resumes Operation Early, Copper Cathode Production Expected in June 2025
tickerNews.content: The President Director of PT Freeport Indonesia, Tony Wenas, stated that the company's smelter in JIIPE, Gresik, has resumed operations earlier than expected. Tony stated that the smelter is expected to produce copper cathodes in the 4th week of June 2025 and reach full production capacity in December 2025.

tickerNews.title: Bitcoin Reaches All-Time High Ahead of US Senate Stablecoin Bill Discussion
tickerNews.content: Bitcoin hit an all-time high, rising nearly +3% to around 110,000 US dollars per unit in morning trading on Thursday (22/5), following progress in the stablecoin bill draft which is now ready to be discussed by the US Senate. Bloomberg reported that a bipartisan group hopes the US Senate can pass the regulatory draft as early as this week, although senators indicated that the final vote might be postponed until after the Memorial Day recess on May 26, 2025.

tickerNews.title: ISSP Controller Increases Stake via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: The controller of Steel Pipe Industry of Indonesia ($ISSP), PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, purchased approximately 11.1 million ISSP shares at a price of 295 Rupiah per share on May 21, 2025. The total transaction reached approximately 3.3 billion Rupiah. After this transaction, PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra's ownership in ISSP increased from 56.12% to 56.28%.

tickerNews.title: Three Suspects Named in Alleged Corruption Case Involving SRIL Loans, Including Former Directors/Officials of SRIL, Bank DKI, and BJBR
tickerNews.content: The Attorney General's Office on Wednesday (21/5) named 3 individuals as suspects in alleged corruption related to bank loans to Sri Rejeki Isman ($SRIL), consisting of former SRIL President Director Iwan Setiawan Lukminto, former Bank DKI President Director Zainuddin Mappa, and former official of Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten ($BJBR) Dicky Syahbandinata. The corruption investigation is related to unsecured loans to SRIL totaling about 693 billion Rupiah. A Director at the Attorney General's Office, Abdul Qohar, stated that the bank officials did not conduct adequate analysis or adhere to procedural requirements in granting the loans.
